title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
Nothing visible on board. Very small area looks like may have been liquid at c8192/7 diode red to ground there is .46V.
Charger is taking 20V pulsing .05A
PPBUS_g3H =13.1V
PP3v3_g3h=3.4V
PP5v_S5 pulsing between 2V-5V
PP3v3_s5 pulsing too quickly to read

These seem low but wanted to ask:
L7410/20/30 resistance to ground: 3.1 ohms
L7210/20= 7.7 ohms to ground

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
You can compare ohm readings with good board.
Seems to be good values for CPU power rails.

Check diode mode on all other big coils and behind all Power FETs.
Just in case, try to start in SMC bypass.

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
Well. damnit I must've messed something up.  All those coils and areas looked good. SMC Bypass didn't work.

I checked solders around U7650 and reflowed it. Something smelled like it burned up while putting heat to board. Board showed same symptoms initially and was pulling 20V, with rails pulsing after this but when I went back for second check no longer boosts to 20V intake. NOw stuck at 5v. Makes no sense to me that something burned up. Is there something that would be temp sensitive near U7650? Or U7650 burned maybe? Thinking maybe this was the case and not seeing any shorts on PP3V3 G3H or around CD3215's, I replaced U7650. NO change. I hate the newer boards...

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message: Check diode mode to ground at U7650 coils.

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
L7670 diode mode is .441V
L7690 diode check is .373V

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message: Post U7650 voltages; pins 23, 12, 13, 22, 29, 21.

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
Those are all 0V.
Maybe what I explained prior was not done well: the board is now only drawing 5V from charger. PPBUS G3H is no longer present, only PP3v3_G3H.

Diode check of PPBUS_g3H is .441V

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message: Do you get 3V3_G3H at least?

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message: yes

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message: Check voltage and diode mode at all LDO rails of CD3215 chips.

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
diode values of caps appear to be good at both U3100/3200 however i do not have 5V at C3201 but C3101 =5V. 

Fuses are ok there. 

I swapped out U3200 to see if any difference but no change and diode values of caps near U3200 still match U3100.

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
You cannot get 5V at C3101/201 at same time; depends where the charger is connected.

"Something smelled like it burned up while putting heat to board"
Check what happened then.
Measure diode mode to ground on all caps from that area and closer coils.

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message: Nothing is out of place. Caps, coils  in the area not shorted. Resistors around U7650 are good.

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
Something happened when you apllied heat on the board for sure; if the problem appeared just after that.
Some BGA chip could be affected by possible accumulated crap.

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
I think this is first time i;ve had something random fry just from heat and not be visibly noticeable like a nearby component not meant for heat. Possible maybe the board could hold enough charge if there was an issue somewhere that would then short something out? It definitely smelled like something shorted, yet no power was being supplied to the board while I was reflowing U7650. 

May have to put a fork in this one as I'm just not finding anything out of sorts. So strange that there are no discoverable shorts on the rails and PPBUS G3H seems good, CD3215 measure legit, yet power draw to 20V is non-existent.

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message: Remove F7000 and check if tries to switch to 20V.

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message: No luck. Sticking at 5V.

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
Ended up pulling a board from A1708 with bad LCD and everything works and passes AHT but external display does not work. No corrosion on board, tried resetting smc and PRAM, Clean ME with Medusa. Nothing detected when plugging in external display to it while booting or after boot. Looking in settings nothing shows for external options when connected to external display. 

Seems very unusual for otherwise fully working mac to have no external display with a board only has IG.

Suggestions?

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
Bad U2800, or affected by corrosion.
USB 2/3 devices work good?
USB-C redriver chip looks good?

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
U2800 looks like a fun job to replace. haha...
Yes I was able to load OS from USB 3.0 adapter/USB installer.
I'm sorry, what chip on this board is the USB-C redriver? I tried searching a MPN you mentioned in another thread but it isn't showing in my schematic

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
It doesn't appear on available schematic/boardview.
Is the small chip near the metal shield of USB ports (PI3USB...).

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
Interestingly when i went to pull chip from the first board in this thread that I smelled something burned... pulling back the plate on U2800 of first board revealed a major crack on the surface of the chip. HOw in the hell or why would that burn up when heating area of U7650?? 

So now I believe I need 2 U2800!! are these transferable from other similar boards or must come from 00840?

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
It has separated TBT ROM, you may try one from other model board.
However, I cannot confirm it works; always better to use same donor board model.

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message: Swapped the U2800 and the TBT redriver chip and still no external display but other uSB functions seem to work. Any other thoughts I can chase down?

title: 00840 Pulsing rails
message:
All the power rails of U2800 are good?
There are few very small chips involved.
